casebody.data:
Alexander J. BOCZ, Appellant, v. HUDSON MOTOR CAR COMPANY et al., Appellees. No. 8875. Circuit Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit. Feb. 11, 1942. Alexander J. Bocz, Detroit, Mich., in pro. per. Jolly & Booth, Butzel, Eaman, Long, Gust & Bills, Barnes, Kisselle, Laughlin & Raisch, Mead & Bevan, H. Bodman, King Harness, and I. Joseph Farley, all of Detroit, Mich., and Drury W. Cooper, of New York City, for appellees.

Before HICKS, MARTIN, and McAL-LISTER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

This cause was heard on the transcript of record, briefs and argument of appellant, in pro. per., and of counsel for ap-pellees. On consideration whereof, it is ordered, adjudged and decreed that the order appealed from be and the same is in all things affirmed.
